results.title: The Artful dodger
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “B.P. Road Safety”.
There is an artful dodger in every crowd and on every road. Demonstrates the driving style of such a person - the dodging in and out of traffic at high speed which is dangerous and can cause frayed nerves and accidents. The dodger is the person who takes unnecessary risks for no apparent reason - he is not a good safe driver. No other credits available.

results.title: Artfest: where do we go from here
results.creator_credit: Gary Kildea, Esau Reuben and Papua New Guinea. Office of Information
results.brief_description: A film which looks at the determination, of the people of Papua New Guinea, to preserve their different cultures. Lifestyles have drastically changed with many people now living in the towns and leaving their village customs behind. This film concentrates on an arts festival which aimed to present traditional ideas and also to incorporate new ones.

results.title: The Art teacher has nine kittens
results.creator_credit: D. Keith Carlson and Educational Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
A basket of kittens serves as a vehicle for experiences in classifying, counting, and colour recognition, and extends an understanding of the birth and care of young animals for a kindergarten class.

results.title: Art survives the times
results.brief_description: A record of art life in France. Leading artists such as Matisse, Picasso, Ultrillo and the sculptors, Roualt, Laurens and Janniot, are shown at work. The architects, Le Corbusier and Perret, also display plans for homes and cities. No other credits available.

results.title: The Art of the real: U.S.A. 1948 to 1968
results.brief_description: The film is about an exhibit called the “Art of the Real” at the Museum of Modern Art in New York City. It illustrates the Americans great concern for their culture and that the culture is real and moving, and sometimes controversial. It employs a variety of techniques including double exposures, vignettes, slow motion, freezes, camera movements, moving lights, etc.
results.title_for_label: The Art of the real: U.S.A. 1948 to 1968

results.title: The Art of the motion picture
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film defines and gives examples of the five basic elements in film making that lend themselves to artistic control by the film maker, and the critical analysis by the film “consumer”; composition, lighting, editing, filming of movement and the use of sound. The film maker uses these to express his ideas with artistic selection and sensitivity.

results.title: The Art of the child
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description: An exposition of child art as practised at home and at school by children of all ages. This film includes a visit to the National Exhibition of children’s art to see the variety of exciting works by young people.

results.title: The Art of meditation
results.creator_credit: Irving Hartley, Films For a New Age and Hartley Productions
results.brief_description: Alan Watts discusses the art of meditation as an alternative to the pressures and frustration of modern life. The film brings him right into the midst of the viewing audience who can follow along as he leads them step by step in the disciplines of body posture, breath control and concentration, toward that state of relaxation that stops “the chattering in the skull”. The film does not set forth the principles of meditation in academic fashion, it is experiential, leaving one with a feeling of peace and well-being.

results.title: The Art of it
results.brief_description: The Australian Youth Orchestra, under conductor John Hopkins, is seen at rehearsal and in a concert performance of Benjamin Britten’s ” Young Person’s Guide to the Orchestra”.

results.title: The Art of hockey umpiring
results.brief_description: A detailed examination of the rules of men’s hockey including such pre match responsibilities of the umpire as personal equipment, dress, ground markings and the extent of the playing area under is jurisdiction. An investigation into common infringements of the rules as seen in context with the game. No other credits available.
